title: Sky routes redrawn to stop flight delays
text:
Sky routes redrawn to stop flight delays Air traffic controllers are planning to scrap the current stacking system Ben Gurr/The Times Air traffic controllers are planning to scrap the current stacking system Ben Gurr/The Times Graeme Paton Transport Correspondent Published 9 minutes ago 
Britain’s most congested airspace is to be radically redrawn amid fears that a surge in traffic could lead to significant flight delays over the next decade. 
Air traffic controllers are planning to scrap the current stacking system, force aircraft to remain higher for longer and impose “variable speed limits” in the skies to cut congestion over the southeast of England. 
Flight paths will also change to take advantage of new onboard GPS-style technology that allows aircraft to fly more accurately over less densely populated areas.
